content.title: Parkes Weber Syndrome
content.description: Limb overgrowth with capillary malformation and underlying arteriovenous fistulas

key_concepts.details: Limb overgrowth, geographic capillary stain, multiple micro-AVFs
May be associated with RASA1 mutations (overlap with CM-AVM)
High-flow lesion with arteriovenous shunting causing warm extremity
High-output cardiac failure, leg length discrepancy, bleeding

content.clinical_significance: Distinguished from Klippel-Trenaunay by high-flow arteriovenous component
content.statement: Parkes Weber Syndrome is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Vascular-Malformations that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Parkes Weber Syndrome helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Parkes Weber Syndrome include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Parkes Weber Syndrome.
